Jia Xichun
Sinclair
ESP
Combo
Lezione Obbligatoria
I had a very precious time learning to converse with my inner self!!
I learned how to be more true to myself by looking into the mirror!
Had a so-so time reflecting upon myself.
After staring into the mirror for a while, my reflection suddenly felt so... unfamiliar. Fear gripped me, and I couldn't focus on the rest of the class.
Is the self in the mirror my reflection, or another being entirely...? The class ended after a prolonged blank stare into the mirror.
Based on the skills I learned, I managed to recreate the model of a machine from Faust's blueprint!
Managed to learn various, detailed mechanical fundamentals about old H Corp. technology!
I had a so-so time learning various technological and engineering knowledge.
I learned various things about engineering, but they're all kind of hazy... I'm going to have to review this material later, or I'm gonna forget all of it.
The class is moving way too fast... Most of Faust's class went completely over my head.
I was completely absorbed in the exhilarating tales of Fixers! I even forgot to breathe at one point!
Time certainly flies when hearing the tales of exciting adventures!
I had a so-so time learning about the Fixers and their deeds.
Today's tale of adventures was a bit boring, but I managed to pay attention through the whole thing.
The class consisted of listening to the same adventure I'd already heard many times in the past...
What a wonderful adventure that was. I'm so excited for our next session—I mean, class!!
Worked with Sinclair to come up with creative solutions to all kinds of trials we faced in the adventure!
I had a so-so time with today's adventure.
Today's adventure was fun, but we barely made any main quest progress.
Total clan kill... Thus the truth of the realm is now lost to darkness...
Managed to understand the troubles most foot-soldiers go through, and learned to get a better idea of the flow of a battlefield!
Now I know enough about urban and trench warfare to give an explanation of my own!
I've gained a so-so understanding of War of the Wings.
I ended up becoming completely absorbed in hearing about Gregor's past, instead of focusing on his lectures on the War of the Wings.
I ended up sympathizing too hard with Gregor's sadness to the point I couldn't focus in class anymore...
I saw right through every assassination method Hong Lu prepared!!
I managed to tell the difference between the bowls by reading Hong Lu and Daiyu's subtle tells!
I had a so-so time with the repetitive practices on looking for tells.
I still don't quite understand how this "hunch" thing works... Still, I managed to get about half of them right.
Literally every bowl I picked contained poison. Today just might not be my day...
Class over.
Took the class.
I had a so-so time with the class.
Why is it so hard to keep things concise...?

So much for saving unnecessary words! I ended up telling every little gripe I had with everything until the class ended. Next time, I'm going to say only what needs saying. I made a promise to myself to do just that.
With only a few words, I managed to "convince" the target to spill all the beans!
Learned some threats and intimidating expressions I could use to frighten the target!
Had a so-so result on learning more intel from the target.
I now know how to interrogate, but every time I had to say something awful to the target, I hesitated.
I don't know how it happened, but the target somehow convinced me to spill all my beans...
F.C. (Flawless Class)!!
Laughing and playing with children brought back fond memories of my own childhood!
I gained a so-so level of knowledge on how to talk to children.
Playing with children is all fine and good, but... it's also very draining.
I made the kid cry... oh no.
I didn't just learn how to hide my feelings... I learned how to make whatever expressions I want. Finally won a round against Rodya!
By playing various games with Rodya, I didn't just learn how to hide my expressions... I learned how to hide my gesture tells, too!
I had a so-so time learning to prevent my emotions from becoming too obvious.
I tried my best to keep a poker face, but I couldn't stop my lips from involuntarily smiling whenever I got the tiles I needed.
Apparently, my expressions were extremely obvious. Rodya fleeced me...
I learned the art of "mad dogging" and decisive action!
Gained an understanding of how I could break the enemy's morale!
Had a so-so time sweating things out.
I was too exhausted to fully keep up with the class.
The weapon slipped out of my hand and struck Heathcliff square in his head... I wasted the entire class time apologizing.
I emptied all distracting thoughts and let the flow of battle swing my weapon. I think I managed to cut through something invisible!!
I meditated to empty everything except for the self. I'm still getting there, but I think I've got an idea!
I think I've gained a so-so understanding of the Night Drifter's teachings.
The Night Drifter's moves are so confusing to follow... not to mention the pungent smell of alcohol making me dizzy.
Shared some drinks with the Night Drifter... dang, that felt good.
